trustfund:
TF026530-TAGPE - ENVIR. TECHNICAL
            ASSISTANCE FUND,TF039949-MALAWI-POWER V PROJECT,TF030164-SWEDEN CTF - ENV (NATIONAL)

abstracts.cdata!:
Assessment of the project's
            achievement of its objectives gives a mixed picture. On
            balance and considering that the decline of the Electricity
            Supply Commission's (ESCOM) raises serious concerns
            about the sustainability of the project in the longer term
            and the utility's ability to expand electricity access,
            the achievement of the overall development objective is
            unsatisfactory. Project sustainability is unlikely, unless
            the viability of the power sector is restored to ensure
            efficient operation and maintenance of the power plants.
            Although the World Bank could have been more proactive in
            the early years of implementation, considering the intensive
            supervision towards the end of the project and careful
            management of the closing date, Bank performance, on
            balance, was satisfactory. Considering especially the
            continuous deterioration of ESCOM, the borrower's
            performance overall was unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned
            were: Cofinanciers should participate in project preparation
            beginning from pre-appraisal, and also participate in the
            appraisal and negotiations of the credit. Subdividing the
            project into numerous contract packages because of
            co-financing considerations led to coordination problems
            during implementation. Energy lending in Malawi should focus
            on four priorities--expanding access to modern energy,
            increasing private participation to reduce the fiscal burden
            of the energy sector, improving reliability, and increasing
            regional integration and energy trade.
